intro: Diplocaulobium ecolle, commonly known as the slender false mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
